title: If 1 + x = 2, what is x? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are different interpretations of your question. Under the most common interpretation of your question, the answer is that x is 1.  However, there are other interpretations. For example, x, 1 and 2 could be vectors.  If you want be less ambiguous, then you must specify what set x is a member of.  The following is completely consistent to the idea that the answer is [math]x = 1[/math]. However, the following wording is less ambiguous to mathematicians than your original wording: Your question could be rewritten as: Find a subset, S, of the real numbers, [math]ℝ[/math], such that all of the following conditions hold: For all x in [math]ℝ[/math], [math]1 + x = 2[/math].there is no [math]x[/math] in [math](ℝ - S)[/math] such that [math]1 + x = 2[/math]

A fairly straightforward question at first, but when you REALLY go deep into it, you find something truly revolutionary. Let’s discard the boring answer out first, 1, ew. But, no one said that x must be a Real Number, should it?? Consider a rank 12 Tensor, a metric tensor of a non trivial non orthonormal tensor with renormalized coordinates and quantized Schwarzschild geometry. If you do that, do the Lebesgue Integral with respect to the 7th dimensional re(re)normalized Polar coordinates, and you get the hidden TRUE meaning of this equation. You get a stunning divergent series, which converges to give you the answer to this question and life itself, 42. Its always my pleasure to point out the awesome subtleties of mathematics. Cheerio!

Thanks to the addition rule we can subtract the same number from each side. (In this case we can subtract 1) 1+x-1 = 2–1 So x= 1 The point is to use some algebraic operations in order to simplify the equation with an equivalent one that has the same result.
Although this is categorised in the section calculus, I’ll have a go at it without using calculus at all 1 + X = 2 X =2–1 X = 1 Hope this helped
1+x =2 1 is having a positive sign, so after shifting towards/after = sign it will take negative sign. X=2–1 X=2
1+x=2 ,- - - (i) Then, X=1 then put the value of 1 in equation (i) 1+1=2 2=2 And x Is a variable..
1 + x = 2 Or, x= 2–1 (taking the one to the right side by changing the sign) Or, x= 1
If 1 + x = 2 then the value of x is : 1 + x = 2 x = 2 - 1 x = 1
x = 1 ( Solution with even minor details, as 1+x=2, x=2–1 i.e x=1)
If x+1=2 then x=1 Now replace the variable with its value and 1+1=2
1+x=2 x=2–1(taking +1 in right side it will become -1) x=1
1+x=2 Then x=2-1 The value of x =1
X = 1 Just take 1 away from both sides. 1+X-1 = 2–1 So, X = 1
X + 1 = 2 X = 2 - 1 X = 1 is the answer!!
